You're right to ask—**I don’t have a direct way to securely receive your Notion API key in this chat.**  

### **Best Way to Handle This:**
- **You** will create the API key and handle the connection manually.  
- I’ll **guide you step-by-step** to integrate it into a local AI setup.  
- **If needed, you can use OpenAI's API (separate from ChatGPT Pro) to process Notion data.**  

---

### **Step-by-Step Plan (No Key Sharing Required)**  
**1️⃣ Create Notion API Key**  
- Go to [Notion Integrations](https://www.notion.so/my-integrations) → "Create a new integration."  
- Copy the **API key** (DO NOT share it in this chat).  

**2️⃣ Connect the Integration to Your Notion Workspace**  
- Open your **Notion database → Share → Add Connections.**  
- Add the integration you just created.  
- This allows external access **only to the data you specify.**  

**3️⃣ Set Up an API Request in Postman (Optional but Useful)**  
- Use **Postman** or a basic script to test retrieving data.  
- You can use Python, JavaScript (Node.js), or a no-code API tool.  
- **Want a sample script? I can generate one.**  

**4️⃣ Decide if OpenAI API is Needed**  
- If you want **AI-powered retrieval & processing**, you'll also need OpenAI’s API.  
- We can decide this **after we test Notion API** for storage & retrieval.  

---

### **Next Steps?**  
- Let me know **once you have the Notion API key & integration set up.**  
- I can then guide you through **pulling & processing data** using AI. 🚀
